reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good reception with always cheerful staff. Our room on first floor facing west looking out on pool. Clean bright decent decoration (magnolia theme!). Good lighting plenty of hot water all the time. Self catering with fridge; 2 ceramic hob; microwave with grill and all the pots and pans (and crockery & cutlery) for 4 in a room for 2! Quiet area 3 minutes stroll to wonderful 20 mile long beach.Life guards started the season's surveilance on 18th Feb! 2 minutes stroll to pine woods with gravel tracks for walking & cycling. Good supermarket 300 yards away - and plenty more shops all near. We enjoyed the 5 of the many local restaurants our favourite was O Tapas with a 10 euro touristic (sic) menu which incuded 1 bottle of for a couple 3 good courses; coffee (with milk if needed) and an Almond liquour. Choice here included 10 large bbqed prawns! Buses good to get around - if you need to! Villa Real 2 miles away with ferry to Spain worth a trip. Casto Marim with its castle and salt lagoons with Storks; Spoonbills; "Flaming Joes"( those pink things); Stints etc etc is also 2 miles away.
reviews.title: Perfect studio room; clean light well equipped and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this break last minute, then read reviews, we were a bit aprehensive after reading the negative comments, I can only say what we found. We had a studio room on the 2nd floor, the towels were changed every two days, the bedding every 3 days, the cleaner emptied the bins every day and swept and mopped the floor, the studio was cleaned when the bedding was changed, the room had a fridge, halogen hob, microwave, pans, kettle for the hob and enough crockery, glasses,knives and forks for four people, air conditioning and TV, if some people think this is basic they must normally stay in 4/5 star accomodation.
reviews.title: Nice surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We first visited this hotel in May 2010 and was so pleased with the apartment that we returned in October. Big mistake.
reviews.title: Chalk and cheese

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In May we got an apartment on the fifth floor overlooking the pool. It was great--very spacious and loads of privacy, also generally quiet at night. Manager a nice friendly helpful guy.
reviews.title: NEVER AGAIN WILL I VENTURE TO MONTE GORDO

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: On our booking form for the return visit in October we specified that we required the same rooms. Were never told there may be a problem here. On arrival at reception, we were given a room on the third floor overlooking a busy main road. We asked for a change but they said they were fully booked?????? For the first five nights we could not get a full nights sleep because of noise. A local cafe had just been opened over the road and the locals don't speak to each other--they shout. Also is opposite a large refuse collection centre. 400bhp Cummins lorry engine running at max revs for nearly 1 hour from 12.45 onwards to empty huge refuse bins. A local dog managed to keep us up most of another night as it was part of a trio in a "Who can bark the longest" competition.This was reported to the manager who refused to go out and stop the incessant barking but said he would phone the police. By morning 6 we had had enough and demanded another room. a girl at the desk moved us along the corridor a fair bit away from the cafe area. For the last two nights the noise was a little subdued and we got some sleep. The tone and attitude of the manager had changed and he never bade us goodbye, unlike the departure on our first trip.
reviews.title: *****EXCELLENT LOCATION AND EXCELLENT HOTEL*****

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read other reviews I was generally suprised as Hotel was great, Beds really comfy, rooms spacious but basic. Hotel staff very pleasent. The hotel is catered more for portugese but if you are looking for a quiet relaxing holiday this is the place to stay. 10 mins to beach and 5 minutes to shops walking. supermarket is in the town about 10 minutes walk. Only down fall with hotel bar did not open for drinks the whole week we were their. also no were to get water in hotel or snacks. I would not Monte Gordo for young adults as their is no night life at all. So if you are looking for a relaxing holiday and very very cheap place to drink and eat out this is the place. oh no iron in room we had to go and buy one.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel very last minute... in fact the night before we arrived.
reviews.title: Cheap... Cheerful... Very Basic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010
reviews.text: We didn't mange to arrange a transfer before we left the UK so had to arrange this at the airport upon arrive. The first quote we got for a taxi was 72euro!! we managed to get this down to 55euro. We did while we were there arrange a transfer through suntransfers.co.uk for our return.
reviews.title: Had a great time, food, views, staff, excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was a little worried that the hotel maybe they wouldn't have our booking from Hotels4U but was surprised upon check in.
reviews.title: Average 3 stars (with a kitchen)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our confirmation it stated that checking in was from 1400.... but upon arrival at 12noon we were told it was 1600!!! after a little discussion we were told that it was fine for us to check in then and that we had been upgraded from a studio room which we had originally booked to a 1 bed apt.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just got back from a sunny week in Monte Gordo, self-catering at the Alba Hotel. Pleasantly surprised by the size of our rooms; good shower; very basic cooking facilities (2 rings, and microwave - but it grilled too, which was useful) but all the equipment was of a good quality, so you didn't have to battle with rubbish tin openers or blunt knives! Comfortable beds; good air conditioning in both the bedroom and living room; efficient daily maid service (though their timing was unpredictable ... and they arrived several times when my teenage children were still in bed); very helpful Reception staff (who also manage the little bar) who had good English; clean pool with plenty of sunbeds and umbrellas (though several of them were very wobbly and past their prime). We were on the 5th (out of 6) floor were it was very quiet - avoid a few rooms on the ground floor near the entrance hall which I should think are rather noisy. We didn't eat in the restaurant at all, so I can't comment on that. Good, reasonably-priced restaurants nearby, which was useful as the local supermarket (just over the road) is very limited; good bread and fruit but don't expect much else!
reviews.title: Happy to recommend the Alba!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Very hard to fault this hotel - good food, clean hotel, decent pool, friendly staff, great location. Also I think it's worth pointing out breakfast was only €3 each!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: Wasn't expecting too much from this hotel as it was fairly cheap. But was pleasantly surprised, rooms were a decent size, but had no iron or kettle (self catering) and no double beds just two single pushed together. They were cleaned every day. The pool area was decent enough too.
reviews.title: Good location and clean rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was only about 5 min walk to the beach which was excellent too.
reviews.title: best hotel in monte gordo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Monte Gordo can be quiet but we found it fine and a nice place to relax.
reviews.title: Enjoy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a week at the Alba in May 2012. Emailed the hotel beforehand to advise that my husband was recovering from a serious illness & it was also our wedding anniversary & requested a quiet, comfortable room. This email obviously fell on deaf ears...
reviews.title: Reasonable for a short break but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in room 219, overlooking the road with a balcony that got no sun whatsoever.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The entrance to the hotel was clean & well maintained. The staff were approachable & friendly. Our room was very clean & the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was also pristine. It is an "aparthotel" & has a mini kitchen complete with fridge & microwave should you wish to cook. We didn't but unfortunately other guests did & there was often a lingering "school dinners" smell in the corridors. The worst thing about this hotel is the noise. The doors bang & slam & you can hear every footstep in the hall. If they insulated the doors properly & put a carpet in the hall it wouldn't be so bad. There were dogs barking intermittently most nights. We may as well have left the balcony door open for what good it did with soundproofing. The man in the nest room talked loudly all night. Apparently guests who were lucky enough to get rooms overlooking the pool didn't suffer at all. We went out of season, I'd hate to go in high season.
reviews.title: Good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is bland & boring but the Dutch guests, of which there were many, were tucking in. You have a choice of cake, yes cake. Hard boiled eggs, processed cheese slices, salami, yes, salami & ham. The fruit salad is pieces of apple with mandarin segments & the yoghurt looked like cottage cheese. The bread was delicious!
reviews.title: we are happy to recommend this hotel-apart to anyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was FREEZING! We were also unlucky enough for our trip to coincide with the painting of the hotel nest door. We literally lay by the pool watching paint dry, the highlight of our trip to Monte Gordo, which I believe is Portugese for "Gods Waitingroom"
reviews.title: Well located, not bad!
